column4: My Network usage always reports, I am uploading 217 kb/s and I am receiving 391 Kb/s (varies evry time), even if my computer is idle in Ubuntu 7.10?
is this "Local Network" or "Internet" usage?
got no idea jamiejackson ( as to where they are stored )
I am chcking this in System Monitor utility in Resources Tab.
do you have a home network?
No
check your isp usage and make sure you haven't been using "alot" or anything, it's probably local throughput.
i take you aren't downloading updates or anything when you are "idle"
No, none of the programs that uses Internet like Torrent clients etc are running.
disconnect your internet cables for a moment and see if the activity stops, and if anything produces an error etc.
and then come back ofcause
ok, but one question before disconnecting.
as many as you like harsh1
thats the one
What information will be displayed in the System Monitor->Resources(Tab)->Network History->(Received, sent)?
google the error Morydd refrain from repeating it here
not sure what you mean, it logs network activity.
u google errors
it's very unlikely someone in here has encountered the same error message and remembers it
if they have they would have said it already
I was asking this question because this is the place where it is showing Sent=317 Kb/s and received=117 kb/s, is this normal?
